definition: to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
to make a copy/to plagiarize/to search and seize/to raid/to grab/to go off with/to take a shortcut/to make a turning move/to fold one's arms

sentences.english: We enveloped the enemy on the right.
In the north, the Germans closed in on Leningrad.
sentences.chinese: 在北方，德國人包抄了列寧格勒。

sentences.english: And above all, remember you are loved.
sentences.chinese: 最重要的是，記住，你被愛包抄。

sentences.english: The hunters were closing in for the kill.
sentences.chinese: 獵手們四面包抄過來，捕殺即將開始。

definition: to provide support/to come to the rescue
to stop/to obstruct/to bar the way
pincer attack/attack from two or more sides/converging attack/attack on a flank/fork in chess, with one piece making two attacks
to surround/to close in around (one's enemy, prey etc)
to ambush/to lie in wait for/to lie low/ambush
to make a surprise attack/to pounce on (an enemy)
to rake with machine gunfire/to strafe/to machine-gun down
